data.event: The town is in the Greater Hume Shire Council area which was established in May 2004 from the merger of Culcairn Shire with the majority of Holbrook Shire and part of the Hume Shire.
They travelled through in 1824 looking for new grazing country in the south of the colony of New South Wales.
The town was originally called Ten Mile Creek and the first buildings were erected in 1836.

event.title: became the publican of the Woolpack Hotel on 29 July 1840

data.event: A German immigrant, John Christopher Pabst, became the publican of the Woolpack Hotel on 29 July 1840 and the area became known as "the Germans".
By 1858 the name had evolved into the official name of Germanton, though the postal area retained the name Ten Mile Creek.
In 1876 the name Germanton was gazetted and the old name Ten Mile Creek consigned to history.
